snippet: Samuel J. Crump and Ray H. Adams, who were arrested in 2011, were convicted on charges connected to possession of ricin for use as a weapon.
abstract: Federal Judge Richard W Story sentences Georgia men Samuel J Crump and Ray H Adams to decade each in prison for their roles in 2011 plot that included using ricin in a series of attacks in major cities; sentences end case that involved line between rhetoric and criminal conduct.
lead_paragraph: Samuel J. Crump and Ray H. Adams, who were arrested in 2011, were convicted on charges connected to possession of ricin for use as a weapon.

headline.main: Two in Ricin Terrorism Plot Are Each Sentenced to 10 Years in Prison
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Two Men Get 10-Year Terms in Ricin Plot
